snippet: As the band prepares for its last of its 50th anniversary “Fare Thee Well” concerts, some Deadheads, among the most ardent of music fans, contend that attendance is not necessary.
abstract: Grateful Dead fans balk at hype surrounding band's last concerts, complaining over commercialization runs counter to rock group's spirit; deadheads are also upset with substitution of Phish guitarist Trey Anastasio for deceased bandleader Jerry Garcia and disdain packaging concerts as ‘last’ since many feel band ended with Garcia’s 1995 death.
lead_paragraph: As the band prepares for its last of its 50th anniversary “Fare Thee Well” concerts, some Deadheads, among the most ardent of music fans, contend that attendance is not necessary.

headline.main: As Grateful Dead Exit, a Debate Will Not Fade Away
headline.print_headline: As Dead Exit, a Debate Will Not Fade Away
